subject: Re: [junit] parameterized test cases, test reporting, and CruiseControl
msgSnippet: I ve always found using the message is sufficient to let me know which one failed; using JUnit 3.8.x or 4.x. I d be interested in learning more if this doesn t
messageBody:
I've always found using the message is sufficient to let me know which one
failed; using JUnit 3.8.x or 4.x.

I'd be interested in learning more if this doesn't satisfy your requirement.

Cheers,

James

On 13 Mar 2007 15:30:29 -0700, Jeffrey Fredrick <jeffrey.fredrick@...>
wrote:
>
> Interesting question. Does the Ant xml output give any information to
> distinquish between them?
>
> One idea might be to use the optional message parameter on asserts,
> but that doesn't help you if there is an expected exception.
>
> Perhaps you could override TestCase.getName() to indicate which set of
> parameters are being used?
>
> Jtf
>
> On 3/13/07, Bradley, Todd <todd.bradley@...<todd.bradley%40polycom.com>>
> wrote:
> > Hi, I was teaching one of my coworkers how to create a parameterized
> > test case to solve some of his problems, but he asked me a zinger. How
> > will I know when I look at the CruiseControl test results page which
> > test instance goes with which parameters? I didn't really know.
> >
> > We're using CruiseControl and JUnit 3.8. The default Test Results page
> > just shows the name of the test methods, their status (Success, Failure,
> > or Error), and how long they took to run. But if he's got a suite of 20
> > instances of the same test (just with different constructor arguments)
> > how can he tell which one it was that failed?
> >
>
> --
> http://www.developertesting.com/
> http://www.junitfactory.com
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
